text: it's kind of a japanese-inspired limb so
we've got a dragon and then a lady in a
kimono with little drawers
I was working for a company making
realistic-looking prosthetic limbs for
amputees and there was a little girl
that would attend the clinic and I make
her realistic limb every year and she
wanted something a little bit different
though and started off with little
images of pigs eating ice creams riding
bicycles I could see from a
rehabilitation point of view what an
impact this had on her so I thought well
this is really interesting
making something alternative and having
rather than a standard kind of
replacement and exploring the space and
then I thought well yeah we could make
some really unusual pieces that kind of
spoke from people soul as it were and
and and people's imagination but turning
them into kind of reality and works of
Arts all these have been laser cuts
little wooden pieces and there's also
some secret compartments as well and
realistic fingers so it's almost like
just an accessory
I thought it wouldn't be wonderful to
actually work with someone who shared
the vision of embracing their lemon in
it in a different way and so when I
found Victoria modesta who is a
performing artist and a singer and we
worked together and I made several
covers for her one of which was used in
the Paralympic closing ceremony I think
it captured the spirit that visually of
the Paralympics and and what it means to
be kind of superhuman almost and so we
had the shape of her leg and then just
kind of chopped into it and took chunks
out and just made it encrusted with
crystals and rhinestones I get to the
point where I'm kind of making an
alternative limb and I think yeah this
looks really good but it's it's nothing
when it's unless it's being worn by the
person that it was intended for and that
is just incredible to see when
functioning as a body part but perhaps
someone would go for a realistic cut
option because and they want to complete
their body as maybe nature intended and
it brings them a sense of body balance
security I guess and most importantly
control the silicon comes in two parts
in clip clear and then you mix it up on
the machine and with all these various
skin tones and colors and this this all
be scratched in so all the colour is in
the material all these different skin
tones have all been applied in thin
layers and then scratched into the
material
some of them are really fun like that
was one for a military guy and it was
kind of combination of realist
it had realistic elements and our
alternative once it had realistic tones
and I've been with him when he's worn it
and it really kind of confuses people
because they're saying like oh you're I
can see that you're you've got your foot
but what's going on with the rest how is
that possible hang on that's not your
foot is it
I like making those kind of pieces
because the conversation has changed
from one of pity to one of amazement I
think the alternative limbs kind of
definitely open up a dialogue and it's a
kind of unspoken dialogue which is look
at this I'm giving you something to look
if you want to come and speak to me
about my prosthetic I'm clearly kind of
happy for you two to talk about it and
as I'm expressing myself and rather you

then I'll give you something good to
